page.title: 16DAMERONS FARM
page.content: wner Mr Wrathall and brother. Have lived here since 1950 when their father bought the farm. Not local. Own 116 acr of land half grass for dairy herd other half is corn. Have 50 cows but employ no other workers. All bull calves for beef, heifers for restocking dairy herd All corn grown fed to animals. Old Victorian farmhouse sold and present farm owners & families live in house and bungalow nearby. Damerons owned farm in 16th century but emigrated to New World. In 1930's owner of Damerons Farm, Rectory Farm & ewland Hall employed over 30 men;only 6 or 8 were employed at Damerons Farm. 1980's - Farming not so hard physically because of machinery but just as hard competitively. Machinery makes it possibe for just 2 men to run the farm.
